contentrichtext.text: '''ISO/IEC 14443''' ''Identification cards -- Contactless integrated circuit cards -- Proximity cards'' is an international standard that defines [[proximity cards]] used for [[Identification (information)|identification]], and the transmission protocols for communicating with it.<ref name=14443-1>[http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_ics/catalogue_detail_ics.htm?csnumber=39693 ISO/IEC 14443-1:2008 Identification cards -- Contactless integrated circuit cards -- Proximity cards -- Part 1: Physical characteristics]</ref><ref name=14443-2>[http://www.iso.org/iso/home/store/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=50941 ISO/IEC 14443-2:2010 Identification cards -- Contactless integrated circuit cards -- Proximity cards -- Part 2: Radio frequency power and signal interface]</ref><ref name=14443-3>[http://www.iso.org/iso/home/store/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=50942 ISO/IEC 14443-3:2011 Identification cards -- Contactless integrated circuit cards -- Proximity cards -- Part 3: Initialization and anticollision]</ref><ref name=14443-4>[http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=50648 ISO/IEC 14443-4:2008 Identification cards -- Contactless integrated circuit cards -- Proximity cards -- Part 4: Transmission protocol]</ref> ==Standard== The standard was developed by the ''Working Group 8'' of ''Subcommittee 17'' in ''[[ISO/IEC JTC1|ISO/IEC Joint Technical Committee 1]]''. === Parts === * ISO/IEC 14443-1:2008 Part 1: Physical characteristics<ref name=14443-1/> * ISO/IEC 14443-2:2010 Part 2: Radio frequency power and signal interface<ref name=14443-2/> * ISO/IEC 14443-3:2011 Part 3: Initialization and anticollision<ref name=14443-3/> * ISO/IEC 14443-4:2008 Part 4: Transmission protocol<ref name=14443-4/> === Types === Cards may be Type A and Type B, both of which communicate via [[radio]] at 13.56 [[MHz]]. The main differences between these types concern modulation methods, coding schemes (Part 2) and protocol initialization procedures (Part 3). Both Type A and Type B cards use the same transmission protocol described in Part 4. The transmission protocol specifies data block exchange and related mechanisms: #data block chaining #waiting time extension #multi-activation ISO/IEC 14443 uses following terms for components: * PCD: proximity coupling device (the [[card reader]]) * PICC: proximity [[integrated circuit card]] == Physical size == Part 1 of the standard specifies that the card shall be compliant with [[ISO/IEC 7810]] or ISO/IEC 15457-1, or "an object of any other dimension".<ref name=14443-1/> ==Notable implementations== *[[MIFARE]] cards *[[Calypso (electronic ticketing system)]] *iCLASS cards and tags by [[HID Global]]{{citation needed|reason=these are ISO15693, or vicinity cards|date=January 2013}} *[[Biometric passports]] *[[EMV]] payment cards ([[PayPass]], [[payWave]], [[ExpressPay]]) *[[German identity card]] *[[Near Field Communication]] is based on in part, and is compatible with, ISO/IEC 14443 ==See also== *[[ISO/IEC 7816]], "with contact" smart card standard *[[International Civil Aviation Organization#ICAO standards|International Civil Aviation Organization Standards]] * [[List of ISO standards]] == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://wg8.de/sd1.html Draft ISO/IEC 14443 standards] *[[Atmel Corporation]], [http://www.atmel.com/dyn/resources/prod_documents/doc2056.pdf Requirements of ISO/IEC 14443 Type B Proximity Contactless Identification Cards, Application Note], Rev. 2056B–RFID–11/05 *[http://www.CalypsoTechnology.net The Calypso ticketing standard] *[http://www.waazaa.org/14443/ Final Committee Drafts in pdf form] {{ISO standards}} {{DEFAULTSORT:ISO IEC 14443}} [[Category:Radio-frequency identification]] [[Category:Contactless smart cards]] [[Category:ISO/IEC standards|#14443]] {{standard-stub}}
